4. Compare the number of times Alexander III appears as an elevator with the total number of individuals listed in the table. If Alexander III elevated cardinals more than one third of the individuals listed, then it would be true that he elevated cardinals in 3 or more of the 9 cases.
5. In this case, Alexander III elevated cardinals for 3 out of the 9 individuals listed, which is exactly one-third of the total number of individuals listed. Therefore, the claim is TRUE.
